Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe’s most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements


2-8+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Strong statistical knowledge
Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.



Preferred Qualifications


Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.



Hybrid work at Stripe

This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office).

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual salary range for this role in the primary location is C$128,700 - C$174,100. This range may change if you are hired in another location. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings (“OTE”) range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and specific location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the primary location may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Specific benefits and details about what compensation is included in the salary range listed above will vary depending on the applicant’s location and can be discussed in more detail during the interview process. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; retirement plans; health benefits; and wellness stipends.

Title: Data Analyst (6-mth Contract)
Description:
About MaRS

MaRS Discovery District (@MaRSDD) in Toronto is one of the world’s largest urban innovation hubs.

MaRS supports promising high-growth companies to scale their businesses globally, while tackling key societal challenges in areas such as Health, Cleantech, Finance, Transportation, AI, and others. In addition to helping start-ups launch, grow and scale, the MaRS community is dedicated to cross-disciplinary collaboration, commercialization of discoveries, and driving ideas to impact.

MaRS is the place where you can play a meaningful role in our innovation economy.

We understand qualifications on a job posting can be daunting. If you're passionate about the role and believe you can make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you, even if you don't meet every listed qualification. We’re always looking for great talent to join our team on planet MaRS.

We actively encourage all candidates, including equity-deserving communities, including those who identify as BIPOC, racialized, women, people with disabilities, and people with diverse gender identities, expressions and sexual orientations.

We want you to be comfortable being your most authentic self throughout our recruitment process. Please reach out to careers@marsdd.com if there’s anything we can do to make your experience more accessible and inclusive, including accommodations. Include 'Accessibility Request' in your subject line.

About The Ventures & Ecosystems

This role resides within the V&E group at MaRS. V&E works with over 1400 innovation-driven science and technology startups. V&E helps entrepreneurs commercialize innovations with high business growth potential in Canada and globally by facilitating access to the customer, talent, funding, marketing and stakeholder connections required to successfully scale their business.

About The Position

The role of Data Analyst requires the collection of data through various channels (by running surveys, web-scraping etc), consuming data from third-party sources and in-depth knowledge on cleaning and processing augmented data. The Data Analyst must utilize or create best practices for analyzing, validating, and reporting and be able to clearly articulate the methodologies that were employed in their calculations. The Data Analyst will also identify trends in the data and communicate them to stakeholders through visualizations, reports, and presentation decks

This role is a 6-month contract.

Key Responsibilities


Database Management and Organization
Practice good data hygiene and look for areas to improve data hygiene to support smooth operations and processes, more comprehensive data analysis, and facilitate data privacy and governance best practices.
Documentation of queries and code, methodologies, that are used for key and re-occurring metrics.
Ingest proprietary data collected from surveys along with third party data into data warehouse and augment to existing data sets
Data Collection
Conduct end-to-end venture data collection by building and hosting surveys for MaRS and other Innovation Hub ventures, scraping data from websites, cleaning and processing third-party venture data using advanced SQL queries and Python for reporting to the Federal/ Provincial Government, internal stakeholders, or other designated organizations.
Support the automation of routine tasks such as translation of data from one file format to another, currency conversions, and building dashboards containing regularly requested data.
Data Analysis
Leverage SQL and Python for data cleaning, data manipulation, data augmentation
High level statistical analysis of data to obtain key metrics and reporting numbers
Creation of data visualizations in Tableau, Excel, Google Sheets
Identify data points of interest for stakeholders

Qualifications


Bachelor’s level, Technical/academic/vocational training and/or equivalent work experience. Relevant areas: Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics. A Master's degree in the same relevant areas is an asset.
1+ years working in a data-specific analytics capacity
1+ years working in a role requiring data collection & cleaning (surveys, web scraping, third party data downloads)
1+ years supporting the development of data products or dashboards
Experience leading data collection exercises or cleaning and organizing data warehouse, an asset
Relational Database, SQL/PostgreSQL – querying, joins, materialized views
Analytical Programming Language (Python)
Version Control (git, GitHub)
Data Visualization Software (PowerBI, Tableau, Looker etc.)
Basic Statistical Analysis (summary statistics)
Basic knowledge of data confidentiality & governance best practices



Stakeholder management skills

Applications will close at 5pm EDT on December 12, 2024.

Applicants must be legally eligible to work in Canada and reside in Ontario.

Salary Range: $60,000 - $76,000, extended healthcare benefits, lifestyle spending account, and paid time-off.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for gathering, cleaning, and interpreting complex datasets, translating them into actionable strategies that can contribute to business growth. Your expertise in statistical modeling and predictive analysis will support strategic initiatives, and your ability to communicate findings through reports and visualizations with the managers and executives will be essential for our company’s market decisions. As a key contributor to data-driven strategies, your role in the company’s evolution will be highly visible.




Responsibilities:

Analyze Market Data: Evaluate market trends and conditions, interpreting large datasets to extract actionable insights.
Analyze Sales Data: Perform in-depth analysis of sales patterns to identify opportunities for growth, while managing downside risks.
Market Strategy Recommendations: Based on data analysis, propose strategies to optimize market positioning and enhance business performance.
Hypothesis Testing: Conduct hypothesis tests using natural experiments to validate findings and improve decision-making.
Statistical Modeling: Develop and apply statistical models to predict future sales trends and forecast outcomes.
Active participation: Engage with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and stakeholders through interviews and field research to refine models, ensuring they align with business needs and identifying factors outside statistical scopes.




Qualifications:

A bachelor’s degree in data analytics, computer science, statistics, information systems, or a STEM discipline with demonstrated knowledge in statistics.
A high level of Python proficiency: Strong background in Python programming, particularly for data analysis and modeling.
Strong experience in commonly used data libraries like Pandas, Scikit-learn (sklearn), and NumPy, etc.




Your Background

Attention to detail
Critical thinking skills and analytical skills
Ability to multitask and adapt to a rapidly changing problem
Strong communication skills
Prior experience in sales, marketing and distribution is an asset
Prior knowledge of vaping products is an asset




Perks

Talented team in a fast-paced, free thinking environment
Performance bonuses
Discounts on products we develop
Competitive salary

Title: Data Analyst - Strategic Planning and P&L Management
Description:
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.

Data and analytics are at the heart of Lyft’s products and decision-making. As a member of the Central Market Management team, you will work in a dynamic environment, where we embrace moving quickly to build the world’s best transportation. Analyst leads take on a variety of problems, ranging from shaping critical business decisions to deep dive analysis and identifying investment opportunities. We’re looking for a passionate, driven Analytics Lead to take on some of the most interesting and impactful problems in ridesharing.

We are looking for a junior analyst to join the Strategic Planning and P&L management team within the Rideshare Central Management organization. This individual will work on key initiatives for Lyft’s Rideshare business and work closely with Data Scientist and Analysts in the team to shape Lyft’s future investment strategies.

The P&L management team sits within the Central Market Management organization and reports through the Head of Rideshare. Our team is heavily cross-functional as we are at the intersection between Product, Engineering, Finance, Data Science, and Operations. You’ll own workstreams, analyses, modeling, strategy, and business metrics. We are looking for analytical talent to provide insights and actionable recommendations that will drive impact.

Responsibilities:


Leveraging analytics and data science to analyze business problems
Working closely with investment lever teams to recommended strategies in quarter investments
Data manipulation and business metrics reporting
Partner with Data Scientist and Engineers to improve models and processes
Present findings, recommendations, and results to senior leadership and cross-functional stakeholders


Experience:


Experience in leading high visibility projects and influencing others in a cross-functional team environment
Experience in communicating with and presenting to senior leaders and data storytelling
3+ years experience in management consulting, investment firms, strategic data science/analytics roles in a technology company, or an equivalent analytical role in a high growth startup
Experience in strategic investment, prioritizing against different projects, and leading teams in deep dive analysis, business metrics, and implementation
Ability to independently break down large datasets and synthesize inputs from multiple sources
Ability to craft a compelling story and concisely present recommendations across teams and levels including both technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to influence, negotiate, and inspire others in a fast-moving environment
Excellent organization, planning skills, and attention to detail
Ability to use data visualization tools to provide actionable insights and reusable frameworks
Strong financial knowledge and understanding of profit and loss
Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in Spreadsheet and SQL; Python a plus


Benefits:


Extended health and dental coverage options, along with life insurance and disability benefits
Mental health benefits
Family building benefits
Access to a Health Care Savings Account
In addition to provincial observed holidays, team members get 15 days paid time off, with an additional day for each year of service
4 Floating Holidays each calendar year prorated based off of date of hire
10 paid sick days per year regardless of province
18 weeks of paid parental leave. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible

Lyft also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Accommodation for persons with disabilities will be provided upon request in accordance with applicable law during the application and hiring process. Please contact your recruiter now if you wish to make such a request.

This role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule — Team Members will be expected to work in the office 3 days per week on Mondays, Thursdays and a team-specific third day. Additionally, hybrid roles have the flexibility to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per year.

Technical skills combined with consulting skills to support decision-making, drive business growth, and deliver value through data-driven insights.

Plan, conduct and direct the analysis of business needs that require resolution through custom application interfaces and/or other technical solutions.

Work directly with clients and internal customers to provide ongoing training, answer application questions, support user needs, and recommend solutions.

Description:
Data Analyst

Full-time, Hybrid or Remote

Location: Anywhere in Canada or NFLD (must support ATL timezone)




Our client is a vertically integrated, licensed producer of premium cannabis products based in Newfoundland. They are a tight-knit company known for their innovative products, ‘all hands on deck’ attitudes, and commitment to excellence in the cannabis industry.




They are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Data Analyst to oversee company-wide data and reporting (including sales, operational, and financial data).




This new role will be critical in enhancing their data capabilities, providing actionable insights, and supporting the leadership team’s strategic objectives.




This position will be responsible for developing reports/dashboards, tracking KPIs, identifying trends, and delivering insights that will drive business performance.




MUST have prior experience in a similar role within Canada’s licensed cannabis market and familiarity with industry-standard POS/Seed-to-Sale software.




This role can be performed remotely, and candidates can be located anywhere in Canada but must be able to support the regular business hours of the ATL timezone. (Preference if can be based in Newfoundland/East Coast Canada).




Key Responsibilities




Data Management and Analysis: Collect, clean, and analyze data related to sales, operations, and financial performance to support decision-making.
Reporting and Dashboards: Develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards and reports to monitor KPIs, trends, and business outcomes.
Sales Analytics: Track sales performance by product, region, and channel. Provide insights to improve market penetration and revenue growth.
Operational Insights: Analyze operational data to identify areas of efficiency, streamline processes, and support production planning.
Financial Performance Tracking: Collaborate with the finance team to analyze revenue, expenses, and profitability. Provide insights for budgeting and forecasting.
Collaboration: Work cross-functionally with teams such as sales, operations, marketing, and leadership to provide data-driven recommendations.
Software Expertise: Utilize tools such as PowerBI, Breadstack, Cova, and GrowerIQ to extract and analyze data effectively.
Market Insights: Leverage cannabis industry data to identify trends, benchmark performance, and ensure the company remains competitive.




Requirements

Proven experience in a similar data analytics role, preferably within Canada’s licensed cannabis industry.
Expertise in data analytics, reporting, and visualization tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with Cova, and GrowerIQ software is highly preferred.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Ability to present complex data in a clear and actionable manner.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Business, Economics, or a related field is preferred.
Self-starter with the ability to work independently and thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment.

Title: Pricing Data Analyst
Description:
JELD-WEN is currently seeking a Pricing Data Analyst to join our growing team.




Reporting to the Canadian Pricing Manager, you will be part of a team responsible for customer analysis and reporting, as well as internal analytics to enhance decision-making processes. This team also ensures pricing accuracy across Canada. Your role will involve creating customer reports that provide actionable insights and developing data analysis tools for both internal and customer use. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills to extract, organize, manipulate, and summarize large pricing datasets, focusing on identifying and resolving pricing discrepancies and errors. You will also be responsible for generating SOX-compliant reports and ensuring all data aligns with industry-mandated controls. A passion for data analysis is essential, along with experience working with large datasets and handling high data volumes. Familiarity with retrieving data from multiple systems and producing comprehensive reports is also required. Additionally, excellent communication skills are vital, as you will collaborate with teams across multiple departments and global locations.




Duties & Responsibilities:

Analyse customer data to identify key insights and trends.
Develop data analysis tools to identify any incomplete data.
Support sales on customer quotes.
Manage/update price lists.
Develop both internal and customer facing reports to present the data in the most easily consumable way and surface the key insights from the data.
Maintain and improve existing data analysis tools and reports.
Perform Daily SOX CONTROL audit for various Canadian Plants
Verify potential price discrepancies against the master database pricing in the company’s ERP.
Utilize query tools to pull custom reports and data to help in analyzing and finding the root cause of any price discrepancy.
Run BOM (Bill of material) queries for internal stakeholders to aid in item cost analysis.
Create and maintain Power BI or equivalent visual dashboard showing SOX KPI and audit performance for each plant.
Chair monthly audit control sessions with each plant to go over data to identify trends or potential areas of concern.
Track corrective action tickets for discovered pricing errors.




Job Requirements:

Excellent communication skills - written and verbal.
Able to proactively work independently while supporting a team.
Strong ability in prioritizing time sensitive tasks whilst maintaining high levels of attention to detail.
Intermediate to advance Microsoft Excel skills; using VLOOKUPS and PIVOT tables to sort and organize large data sets.
Intermediate knowledge of the rest of the Microsoft Office suite including WORD and POWERPOINT.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and function under pressure to meet deadlines.
Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills to communicate across multiple departments and geographic locations.
Strong analytical and organizational skills
Working knowledge and experience using an ERP system is an asset.
Working experience of SQL Server and/or QlikView (or other, similar reporting databases)
Experience of using relevant software packages, i.e. SAS, SQL, Excel, QlikView, Tableau, Power BI, Access
Knowledge of designing/ developing/ maintaining reporting systems
Have a passion for data and analytics.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
At Kynetec, we're proud to be at the forefront of the intersection between agriculture, sustainability, and animal health. We’re redefining our industry with unparalleled insights and leading technology, whilst on an ambitious growth plan to supersede our influence from the food on our plates, to the health of our livestock and the care of our beloved pets at home.




We owe our success to our industry experts. They are the driving force behind our reputation as a global leader in the industry - Their innovative ideas and expertise have helped us achieve new heights. From seasoned insights specialists, and client leaders to innovative tech genius. What connects us? A shared passion for Agriculture and Animal Health! We don’t settle for “business as usual”.




Each day, we are taking strides towards transforming our industry and improving the lives of people and animals around the world. If you’re looking for a company who challenges the norm and fosters a culture of innovation, Kynetec is the place for you.




The Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Analyst to join Kynetec!




This role is full-time, permanent and 100% remote.




In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and delivering key insights to support strategic decision-making. This role will focus on Kynetec’s Animal Health flagship product, PetTrak - a transactional dataset for millions of pets worldwide.




Responsibilities

Perform complex data analysis using PostgreSQL to identify trends, patterns, anomalies, and insights.
Develop reports that are clear, intuitive and consistent with established templates and formats.
Work closely with Kynetec commercial team regularly and clients directly (when required) to provide data-driven insights and recommendations.
Maintain open lines of communication with team members, providing updates on progress, challenges, and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and ensure data integrity.
Adhere to data governance policies and ensure use of best practices for data security and accuracy.




Requirements

Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis or a related field using PostgreSQL or any other relational databases (SQL Server, Oracle, etc).
Extensive experience in writing complex queries, optimizing performance, and working with large datasets.
Understanding of statistical methods and data analysis techniques.
Proficient in using Excel, including advanced formulas, pivot tables, and data visualization techniques.
Ability to tackle open-ended requests, formulating questions, and deriving actionable insights from data.
Detail-oriented in data analysis to ensure accuracy and reliability of findings.
Strong verbal and written communication skills for documenting and explaining complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Source Control (Git).
Experience with collaboration tools (e.g., Jira, Asana, Trello, Slack, Azure DevOps, Confluence).
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Systems, or a related field or equivalent experience.
Able to work full-time, remote – US and Canada based.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working in animal health preferred.
Experience with Predictive Analytics.
Experience with Snowflake or other cloud-based data warehouses, or willingness to learn and work with cloud-based data warehouses.
Experience with data manipulation and analysis tools (e.g. R, Python, Alteryx, etc).
Experience with analytics and visualization tools (e.g., Sigma, Tableau, Power BI, etc).

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a talented and driven Power BI Analyst to join our clients team on a temporary contract basis. In this role, you will analyze data, design insightful reports, and develop interactive dashboards using Power BI. Your work will play a critical role in transforming complex datasets into actionable insights to support strategic business decisions.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports that align with business objectives.
Partner with cross-functional teams to gather and understand data requirements, translating them into effective BI solutions.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, track key performance indicators (KPIs), and deliver actionable insights.
Ensure the accuracy and reliability of data across all reports and dashboards.
Develop and maintain robust data models to support business intelligence initiatives.
Provide user training and support to maximize the adoption and usability of Power BI solutions.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to dashboards and reports.
Collaborate with data teams to prepare, clean, and integrate data from various sources for analysis.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.
Proven experience with Power BI or similar data visualization tools.
Expertise in DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and Power Query.
Strong background in data modeling and creating interactive dashboards.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and managing data.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with a high level of attention to detail.
Ability to communicate technical insights effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with additional BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Excel) is advantageous.

Preferred Skills:

Familiarity with Microsoft Azure and cloud-based data solutions.
Experience with programming languages such as Python or R for advanced data analysis.




Position Details:

Contract Length: 4–6 weeks, from December 2024 to January 2025, with a break December 25th to Dec 29th, resuming on January 2nd 2025.
Work Environment: Onsite role at our clients Burnaby office, conveniently located near transit with available parking. Remote work is not offered for this position.

Description:
Position Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst

Location: Niagara Falls, Ontario, Canada (Hybrid)

Reports To: Manager, Student Systems and Business Intelligence




Overview

The University of Niagara Falls Canada (UNF) is an innovative and digitally oriented institution that prepares graduates for leadership in a digital world.

Academic programs are aligned to meet the demands of business and industry, providing students with the skills and knowledge needed now and for the future.

UNF’s vision is to offer innovative education and research for a digital world.




Primary Purpose

We are seeking a qualified Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our dynamic team at the University of Niagara Falls (UNF). This position will report directly to the Manager of Student Systems and Business Intelligence within the Office of the Registrar. The BI Analyst combines business acumen and technical skills to address data and reporting needs, including but not limited to Ellucian Insights, Colleague, Power BI, Salesforce, and other applications at the University. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing data, generating reports, quality audits and providing insights that will drive strategic business decisions. By enhancing transactional and reporting functions, the Analyst supports the University's objectives and provides valuable feedback and recommendations to the stakeholders.




Specific Responsibilities:

The BI Analyst will be responsible for the following, as well as other related duties as assigned, to support the business objectives and purpose of the Office of the Registrar and the University:

Recommends, develops, and implements procedures to ensure; the protection, accuracy, and integrity of data, including data monitoring and reconciliations.
Analyse complex data sets and identify trends, patterns, and insights to support decision-making processes.
Work with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into BI solutions.
Research reasons for data anomalies and ensure appropriate corrections or adjustments are made. Documents and reviews any system irregularities and liaises with relevant stakeholders to resolve data anomalies or system questions.
Provides business and technical expertise for the analytics process, tools and applications for the University. Identifies opportunities that improve data accuracy and efficiency of our processes. Contributes to the development of training materials, documenting processes, and delivering sessions.
Assesses appropriate reporting mechanisms, developing customized queries as necessary, maintaining procedures and documentation on query and report details, and documenting and maintaining a report run schedule as needed.
Contributes to business process improvement activities through methods such as analysing processes and recommending improvements using technological functionality, participating as a member of a team in the implementation of technology improvements.
Develop, maintain, and manage advanced reporting, analytics, dashboards, and other BI solutions.
Follows universal and internal reporting standards to ensure consistency and transparency across reports and adheres to privacy and confidentiality policies and measures to protect data and information sources.




Position Requirements:

To be successful in the BI Analyst role, an individual must possess, and be committed to developing, maintaining, and demonstrating the following:

Competencies:

Excellent writing abilities and proven abilities to communicate effectively with all members of the university community, including senior administrators.
Demonstrated ability to analyze, synthesize and translate complex information and data sets for varied uses and diverse audiences and produce publications for multiple stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to exercise sound judgment, prioritize tasks, proactively plan, and anticipate and problem-solve issues as they arise.
Excellent time management, prioritization, multi-tasking skills, and attention to detail.
Ability to work effectively with a wide range of academic and administrative staff and applicants/students.
Knowledge of database management principles, including strong analytical, problem solving and business analysis skills.
Understanding of statistical analysis techniques such as correlation and regression.
Demonstrated ability to collect data from a variety of sources including compiling metrics, synthesizing data, producing reports, and making recommendations.
Ability to work well as a team member in a fast-paced, professional environment.
Ability to adapt to evolving technologies and changing business requirements.




Education and Experience:

Post-Secondary Credential in Computer Science, Business, a related field of study or an acceptable combination of education and relevant experience.
Minimum of two (2) years’ experience working in an analytical and reporting capacity (preferably in an educational institution).
Proven experience in developing and implementing BI solutions using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Ellucian Insights, or similar is required.
Must have strong experience with SQL for querying databases and performing data analysis.
Experience with data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
Proficient in data modeling, database design, and data mining techniques.
Hands-on experience with data visualization and dashboard creation.
Possess an exceptional level of proficiency in the Microsoft Suite, demonstrating comprehensive skills in applications such as Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and collaborative tools like MS Teams and OneNote.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

The Data Analyst position will be involved in creating analysis for the National Infusion Pharmacy Business activities, Inventory analysis and system efficiencies and accuracy. The position supports all teams involved in HCCSS operations, BCS and ProRx. Occasionally this position may provide support to other teams as deemed appropriate by the Manager, Projects & Compliance.

Duties And Responsibilities


Reporting to the Manager, Projects & Compliance, the Data Analyst will identify and communicate data-driven insights that allow the team to make more informed decisions.
Working together with the BCS, ProRx and the HCCSS teams to understand customer demand, developing monthly forecasts, reporting and trend analysis.
Working with the Procurement and Inventory Team to analyze product requirements and demand to ensure adequate pipeline of supply.
Assist with root cause analysis for negative inventory incidents and assist with finding solutions.
Act as a liaison between the Contract Managers and the Purchasing Team to improve the purchasing operations based on data analysis and understanding customers ordering patterns.
Assist with all improvement initiatives pertaining to inventory management.
Establish processes and reporting best practices for order and supply data to support the BCS, ProRx and HCCSS business. Also establish process for monthly sales tracing reports for vendors.
Support Manager, Supply Chain taking into account the competitive environment, internal and external business interests, put forth data-based recommendations for management´s evaluation & decision.
Using statistical tools, interpret data sets, to support diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts.
Supporting Manager, Supply Chain on risks to order supplies in the context of a business environment.
Assist the Manager, Supply Chain in making good relationships with customers and intercompany departments.
Update Selling price as instructed by Contracts Manager.
Assist the Purchasing and Inventory team in consumption analysis for new contract analysis by providing support in consumption analysis.
Support the Manager, Supply Chain in making detailed specifications for new products as and when required.
Providing forecasts & order requirements to Purchasing.

Experience working with large datasets and financial systems.

Title: Power BI Consultant
Description:
Position: Contract

Duration: 12 months w/ Possibility of extension

Work environment: Hybrid (3 days in office)

Location: Calgary




Position Overview

Hammehr invites applications for the role of Power BI Consultant on behalf of our client for a 12-month contract with the possibility of extension. In this role, you’ll be responsible for designing and implementing data-driven reporting solutions that enhance decision-making across our client’s supply chain and procurement operations. Our client is dedicated to providing quality, comfortable housing options across Canada, and they’re focused on helping tenants find a place they can call home. The company culture is collaborative, easygoing, and supportive, with a sense of stability that’s hard to find elsewhere. Here, you’ll experience the satisfaction of making a genuine impact without the high-stress, fast-paced atmosphere common in other work environments.




What You’ll Do

Develop interactive Power BI dashboards and reports focused on supply chain metrics, delivering actionable insights for procurement and operations
Streamline and automate SCM reporting processes, reducing manual workload and increasing reporting efficiency
Establish seamless data integration pipelines from multiple sources, ensuring accurate and reliable data for reporting
Work closely with procurement stakeholders to document reporting requirements, identify key metrics, and translate needs into data solutions
Troubleshoot and resolve dashboard/report issues to ensure high uptime and reliability of reporting solutions
Execute data quality checks and cleansing exercises, enhancing the reliability of SCM data
Stay up-to-date with Power BI features, incorporating relevant advancements to improve reporting functionality
Deliver training and create user documentation to empower stakeholders in navigating and interpreting Power BI reports




Basic Qualifications

5+ years in Power BI development and data modeling to create impactful dashboards that support supply chain insights
5+ years of SQL experience for querying, stored procedures, and data integration with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), ensuring accurate, integrated reporting
3+ years in supply chain analytics with a solid grasp of inventory, procurement, and logistics metrics to address key reporting needs
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work closely with non-technical stakeholders and deliver user-friendly reporting solutions




Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Agile and Scrum methodologies to manage project timelines and adapt to changing requirements smoothly
ETL development skills, including API integration and data lineage tracking, to support advanced data extraction and transformation needs
Proficiency in DAX and Power Query (M language) to create complex calculations and data transformations that enhance dashboard functionality
Familiarity with version control tools like Team Foundation Server or DevOps to track and manage reporting changes as part of a collaborative team
Outgoing and collaborative personality, ideal for building strong relationships with stakeholders in a more casual, approachable work environment




The Challenges

Getting up to speed with our client’s unique supply chain processes and internal systems quickly won’t be easy; expect a lot of new information upfront
With a small BI team stretched across projects, you’ll need to be resourceful and work independently without expecting constant guidance
While the environment is casual, there’s still a need for adherence to project management standards and timelines, which may feel challenging when priorities shift




Your Impact

By creating tailored dashboards, you’ll provide the procurement team with insights they’ve been missing, enabling smarter decisions and streamlined processes
Your reporting solutions will reveal opportunities to optimize inventory, reduce delivery times, and improve supplier relationships, directly impacting the bottom line
As a Power BI expert, you’ll champion data clarity, helping non-technical teams make informed, analytics-based decisions across the organization

Title: Pricing Data Analyst
Description:
JELD-WEN is currently seeking a Pricing Data Analyst to join our growing team.




Reporting to the Canadian Pricing Manager, you will be part of a team responsible for customer analysis and reporting, as well as internal analytics to enhance decision-making processes. This team also ensures pricing accuracy across Canada. Your role will involve creating customer reports that provide actionable insights and developing data analysis tools for both internal and customer use. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills to extract, organize, manipulate, and summarize large pricing datasets, focusing on identifying and resolving pricing discrepancies and errors. You will also be responsible for generating SOX-compliant reports and ensuring all data aligns with industry-mandated controls. A passion for data analysis is essential, along with experience working with large datasets and handling high data volumes. Duties & Responsibilities:

Analyse customer data to identify key insights and trends.
Develop data analysis tools to identify any incomplete data.
Support sales on customer quotes.
Manage/update price lists.
Develop both internal and customer facing reports to present the data in the most easily consumable way and surface the key insights from the data.
Maintain and improve existing data analysis tools and reports.
Perform Daily SOX CONTROL audit for various Canadian Plants
Verify potential price discrepancies against the master database pricing in the company’s ERP.
Utilize query tools to pull custom reports and data to help in analyzing and finding the root cause of any price discrepancy.
Run BOM (Bill of material) queries for internal stakeholders to aid in item cost analysis.
Create and maintain Power BI or equivalent visual dashboard showing SOX KPI and audit performance for each plant.
Chair monthly audit control sessions with each plant to go over data to identify trends or potential areas of concern.
Track corrective action tickets for discovered pricing errors.




Job Requirements:

Excellent communication skills - written and verbal.
Able to proactively work independently while supporting a team.
Strong ability in prioritizing time sensitive tasks whilst maintaining high levels of attention to detail.
Intermediate to advance Microsoft Excel skills; using VLOOKUPS and PIVOT tables to sort and organize large data sets.
Intermediate knowledge of the rest of the Microsoft Office suite including WORD and POWERPOINT.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and function under pressure to meet deadlines.
Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills to communicate across multiple departments and geographic locations.
Strong analytical and organizational skills
Working knowledge and experience using an ERP system is an asset.
Working experience of SQL Server and/or QlikView (or other, similar reporting databases)
Experience of using relevant software packages, i.e. SAS, SQL, Excel, QlikView, Tableau, Power BI, Access
Knowledge of designing/ developing/ maintaining reporting systems
Have a passion for data and analytics.

At Kynetec, we're proud to be at the forefront of the intersection between agriculture, sustainability, and animal health. We’re redefining our industry with unparalleled insights and leading technology, whilst on an ambitious growth plan to supersede our influence from the food on our plates, to the health of our livestock and the care of our beloved pets at home.




We owe our success to our industry experts. They are the driving force behind our reputation as a global leader in the industry - Their innovative ideas and expertise have helped us achieve new heights. From seasoned insights specialists, and client leaders to innovative tech genius. What connects us? A shared passion for Agriculture and Animal Health! We don’t settle for “business as usual”.




Each day, we are taking strides towards transforming our industry and improving the lives of people and animals around the world. If you’re looking for a company who challenges the norm and fosters a culture of innovation, Kynetec is the place for you.




The Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Analyst to join Kynetec!




This role is full-time, permanent and 100% remote.




In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and delivering key insights to support strategic decision-making. This role will focus on Kynetec’s Animal Health flagship product, PetTrak - a transactional dataset for millions of pets worldwide.




Responsibilities

Perform complex data analysis using PostgreSQL to identify trends, patterns, anomalies, and insights.
Develop reports that are clear, intuitive and consistent with established templates and formats.
Work closely with Kynetec commercial team regularly and clients directly (when required) to provide data-driven insights and recommendations.
Maintain open lines of communication with team members, providing updates on progress, challenges, and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and ensure data integrity.
Adhere to data governance policies and ensure use of best practices for data security and accuracy.




Requirements

Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis or a related field using PostgreSQL or any other relational databases (SQL Server, Oracle, etc).
Extensive experience in writing complex queries, optimizing performance, and working with large datasets.
Understanding of statistical methods and data analysis techniques.
Proficient in using Excel, including advanced formulas, pivot tables, and data visualization techniques.
Ability to tackle open-ended requests, formulating questions, and deriving actionable insights from data.
Detail-oriented in data analysis to ensure accuracy and reliability of findings.
Strong verbal and written communication skills for documenting and explaining complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and shifting priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Source Control (Git).
Experience with collaboration tools (e.g., Jira, Asana, Trello, Slack, Azure DevOps, Confluence).
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Systems, or a related field or equivalent experience.
Able to work full-time, remote – US and Canada based.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working in animal health preferred.
Experience with Predictive Analytics.
Experience with Snowflake or other cloud-based data warehouses, or willingness to learn and work with cloud-based data warehouses.
Experience with data manipulation and analysis tools (e.g. R, Python, Alteryx, etc).
Experience with analytics and visualization tools (e.g., Sigma, Tableau, Power BI, etc).
